original_title: Sri Lanka Treasuries yields ease, more bills sold
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields eased across maturities at Wednesday’s auction, with most of the offered bills sold, data from the state debt office showed.
Authorities told dealers that would be no immediate bond auctions. However there is strong demand for bonds.
The debt office sold 97.28 billion rupees of 3-month bills at 19.96 percent, down 3 basis points from a week earlier.
34.1 billion rupees of 6-month bills were sold 17.69 percent, down 8 basis points, after offering 55 billion rupees.
23.95 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 14.29 percent, down 06 basis points. Six and 12 month bills are offered post-auction.  (Colombo/July26/2023)
